definition: Signals that a tribe is normalizing minor breaches or delays until the contract effectively erodes.

positive_examples: Repeated deadline slips are waved away as acceptable.
Action items roll from meeting to meeting with no action.
Counterparty frames chronic issues as 'business as usual'.
Clauses are quietly deprioritized without discussion.
Deviation thresholds are raised to avoid alerts.
Corrective plans are promised but never delivered.
Compensating controls are suggested but not implemented.
They celebrate partial compliance as full success.
Backlogs of breaches exceed capacity yet no escalation.
Logs show the same incident flagged monthly.
Penalty clauses are never triggered despite breaches.
Waivers are granted without expiry repeatedly.
Leadership shrugs at lens alerts as 'noise'.
negative_examples: Action items are tracked to closure with owners.
Language around breaches stays factual and urgent.
Clauses are reprioritized openly when necessary.
Thresholds are tightened when drift appears.
Corrective plans include milestones and proof.
Compensating controls are verified before reliance.
Partial compliance is acknowledged but not overstated.
Backlog burndown charts are discussed weekly.
Penalty clauses are used when warranted.
Variance reports stay on agendas until resolved.
Waivers are rare and tightly justified.
Leadership treats lens alerts as priority signals.
